thread.title: Fun facts about Melbourne and the state of Victoria
thread.title_full: Fun facts about Melbourne and the state of Victoria - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Fun facts about Melbourne and the state of Victoria
text: Food for thought There are more than 3,000 cafés and restaurants serving at least 75 different ethnic cuisines in Melbourne’s laneways – in basements, on rooftops, in historic buildings and countless other quirky spaces. A wine romance Although the second smallest state, Victoria boasts more wine producers than any other in Australia and its great diversity of climate allows the production of almost every wine style imaginable. Café culture Melbourne is the coffee capital of Australia, from the laneways to Richmond and Prahran, the aroma of espresso floats down the streets from cafés serving the smoothest of coffees and tastiest of snacks. Hop on board The Yarra Valley may be famed for its glorious vineyards, but it is actually home to a whole host of artisan breweries, too. Follow the Yarra Valley Cider & Ale Trail for tastings, tours and wonderful brewery restaurants. A fresh experience Tuck in to the freshest food from the region by buying direct from the producers. On the Yarra Valley Food Trail gastronomic hotspots include orchards, farm gates and bountiful roadside stalls. That well-being feeling Etihad Airways’ new economy experience ensures guests have more comfort and space. The smart seat has been designed with a unique fixed wing headrest to create greater privacy and relaxation. In the mood Mood lighting on board your Etihad flight helps provide a relaxed environment and can help with jet lag by gently transitioning the light of the aircraft to reflect the destination and time of the day. That's entertainment In all cabins on board Etihad’s aircraft, guests enjoy an entertainment system with hundreds of hours of movies, TV shows, and box sets from top dramas to comedies. Music and games are also available. Relax before you fly First and Business Class guests flying with Etihad enjoy a personal door-to-door chauffeur service*, providing an undisturbed and relaxing drive before you board your flight. *Terms and conditions apply. The ultimate in air travel The Residence by Etihad is designed for up to two guests. This exclusive three-room suite includes a living room with double seat sofa and 32in TV, bedroom with double flatbed and en suite bathroom. Discover Australia with Etihad Airways, voted the World’s Leading Airline at the World Travel Awards. Etihad offers daily flights from London, Manchester and Edinburgh via Abu Dhabi to Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth from just £655 per person. Terms and conditions apply.
